Posts.Content: Hope you are having a fabulous time and catching up with some rest and recuperation.  Good luck as you start out on the next leg of your journey.  I get my results on Thursday to see where I go next.  Take Care X
Posts.Title: Start FEC-T May 10th

Posts.Content: Wishing you the very best for your operation, I can relate exactly his you feel and I hope all goes well for you.  Please let me know how you get on.  Cyber hug to you  xx
Posts.Title: Panic setting in before operation

Posts.Content: Thank you  for your kind wishes and advice.  I will take it all onboard and as the clock is ticking, my heart is going faster I think.  Thus time tomorrow, hopefully I will be thinking of coming home.  I will let you know how it all goes.  Sending my best wishes to everyone who is about to start on this journey and to everyone who has already started,  cyber hugs to you all. Xx
Posts.Title: Panic setting in before operation

Posts.Content: Well the 18th April is creeping up slowly and I think I am now getting into panic mode.  In for a lumpectomy, WLE, SNB and possible axillary clearance on that date.  Have kept busy leading up to it  to stop me thinking about it all and I think hubby is fed up coming home to another room being decorated. Finished it all now, so have time to think about things and everything is buzzing around in my brain.  Trying  to keep positive, but it is not working too well at the moment. Will let you know how it all goes.  Cyber hugs to you all.
Posts.Title: Panic setting in before operation

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for your reply, I found it most re-assuring and will take all your comments and advice onboard and tackle this head on. Sometimes we just need this help from others who have gone through this already to get us newbies on the right track to positivity.  Once again thank you and I gave a nice big Easter egg just waiting to be smashed to pieces,  Happy  Easter everyone
Posts.Title: Panic setting in before operation
